channel.title: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server
channel.description:
Join The Community
[ul][li]http://www.darkquest.org/forum-102-Questions.html for help with installing, administering, and developing DarkQuest[/li] [li]IRC channel = [url=http://www.darkquest.org/irc.php?dev=1]#darkquest.dev[/url] at irc.rizon.net[/li][/ul]
Information, documentation and resources you need.
[ul][li][url=http://subversion.assembla.com/svn/darkquest/DarkQuest/]SVN repository (includes a rather bare database, usernames: admin, mod, pmod with passwords admin for all)[/url][/li] [li][url=http://www.assembla.com/code/darkquest/subversion/node/logs]Revision log[/url][/li] [li][url=http://www.darkquest.org/tickets]Bug tracker[/url][/li] [li][url=http://www.ibm.com/developerworks/opensource/library/os-ecl-subversion/]How to use SVN with Eclipse[/url][/li][/ul]
For more information, please check http://www.darkquest.org/opensource If you have any questions, ask away (I wont answer questions like "what is javac is unrecognized").
Cleaned this topic of spam. If you're not interesting in helping, don't help. If you're interested in a decent server source, check it out. That's all.

item.title: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server
item.dc:creator: @cleako cleako
item.description:
@cleako wrote:

Just check out revision 69 instead of the HEAD and it won’t have the points system / stat panel. Go through each future commit diff and make the changes you want manually to keep it up to date with the rest.

http://www.assembla.com/code/darkquest/subversion/node/logs?

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server
item.dc:creator: @Kapitein_Bier Kapitein Bier
item.description:
@Kapitein_Bier wrote:

Question, sorry for bumping an old topic, but…

How much different is the DarkQuest Client from the RSCA Client?
Is it just the stat panel?

I want to combine the SQL database with RSC Angel, and I’m not sure if it’s a good idea to use RSCA’s client and edit DarkQuest Server side so the stat panel is gone.

My goal is to have the objects, items, etc stored in SQL, but I prefer not using a stat panel.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Anc13ntsIsBack wrote:

When I attack a Man in Edgeville I gain no experience at all. I’m using the Admin account, but I took the rank off of it & I used a new account I created. Is this just me, or?

Edit: Nevermind, I was using the Rsca client but once I got yours I noticed there was a stat panel. /facepalm

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“bengina, post:11, topic:365479”]When running your client all i seem to get is noclassdeffounderror:defs/itemdef …

Ive looked though and placed all needed resources in their correct places and recompiled after setting the correct directory information but to no avail…

Any help would be appreciated.

Edit - I know what the error refers to (no class found) and i do have my paths set correctly… All other sources work apart from this one… Its just confusing… I may need to leave for a while and come back as ive been looking at it too long lol.[/quote]

If you’re using ant, the runclient method does not reference defs.jar

is missing.

Read full topic

item.source: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server

item.title: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server
item.dc:creator: @Peter Peeter
item.description:
@Peter wrote:

[quote=“super_, post:5, topic:365479”][code]
class Player {
…
Map<String, Object> attributes;
…
void set(String name, Object val) {
attributes.put(name, val);
}

<T> T get(String name) {
    return (T) attributes.get(name);
}

<T> T get(String name, Class<T> clazz) {
    return (T) attributes.get(name);
}
...

}
[/code]

e.g.

player.set("session-key", sess_key);
...
long sess_key = player.get(sess_key, Long.TYPE);

player.set("offence-list", offences); ... List<Offence> offences = player.get("offence-list"); [/quote]

Thanks for the tip, will implement that soon, however I have no idea how to implement ArrayLists in the cache. The problem is type erasure, I can have an ArrayList but as soon as the code is compiled it turns into ArrayList and I have no idea on how to store that in the database so I can restore it as an Integer list.

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

class Player {
    ...
    Map<String, Object> attributes;
    ...
    void set(String name, Object val) {
        attributes.put(name, val);
    }

    <T> T get(String name) {
        return (T) attributes.get(name);
    }

    <T> T get(String name, Class<T> clazz) {
        return (T) attributes.get(name);
    }
    ...
}

e.g.

player.set("session-key", sess_key);
...
long sess_key = player.get(sess_key, Long.TYPE);
player.set("offence-list", offences);
...
List<Offence> offences = player.get("offence-list");

Read full topic

item.title: DarkQuest, the actively developed open source RSC server
item.dc:creator: @iPhone4 iPhone4
item.description:
@iPhone4 wrote:

First version of the cache implemented, with only Boolean, String, Integer and Long. Next version will include Arrays of those 4 types.

The cache is a simplified way of storing player specific data in the database. For example, if you want to store the last time a magic spell failed, all you would have to do is:

player.getCache().store("spellFail", System.currentTimeMillis());

and access it with: (even after the user logs in and out or the game-server is restarted)

player.getCache().getLong("spellFail");

The following code results in the picture below.

if(!player.getCache().hasKey("test")) {
        player.getCache().store("test", "Jyrkz imeb");
}
else {
        player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Cache: " + player.getCache().getString("test"));
}        
if(!player.getCache().hasKey("test1")) {
        player.getCache().store("test1", 1);
}
else {
        player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Cache: " + player.getCache().getInt("test1"));
}
if(!player.getCache().hasKey("test2")) {
        player.getCache().store("test2", true);
}
else {
        player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Cache: " + player.getCache().getBoolean("test2"));
}
if(!player.getCache().hasKey("test3")) {
        player.getCache().store("test3", System.currentTimeMillis());
}
else {
        player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Cache: " + player.getCache().getLong("test3"));
}

Results in: (after a log out and log in)

Read full topic
